result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly L. Hiley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costst.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No violent contact with victim.
------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
------------------------------

timeConds.notes: Complete forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation WITHOUT buyout option.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly L. Hiley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kimberly L. Hiley in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Kimberly L. Hiley in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 16GF190 & 15CM345
MUST POST $500.00 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.S. OR HIS RESIDENCE.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

16-790 & 16-791
Defendant Kimberly Hiley present in court, in custody via video with attorney Julia May. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
